item.title: Report X-2024110550
item.description:
Report X-2024110550

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-18T12:24:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-09
  • City: OAKLAND
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: During sort operations at the OAKH location a fiberboard box was found damaged from rainwater. While getting the contents ready for rewrap a fiberboard box inside was observed to have DG markings and UN spec packaging but there were no DG marks on the outer fiberboard box. The fiberboard box with the DG markings contained a glass vile of mercury UN2809. All contents were placed into a steel salvage package and is being held at the location.

item.title: Report E-2024110234
item.description:
Report E-2024110234

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-15T12:23:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-15
  • City: SANTA FE SPRINGS
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 11:21 AM ET, ULA contacted the call center to report a spill that was found on the dock in Santa Fe Springs, CA. The spill consists of approximately 10 ounces of Potassium Chlorate, which released from 2â€“50-pound paper bags due to the pallet containing a total of 40-to-50-pound paper bags of the same property found tipped over. The terminal stated they will have to restack the pallet and there could potentially be other bags that are leaking. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 10-ounces from 3-damaged bags of product released to trailer floor and adjacent product due to improper loading. The contractors overpacked bags of product, plastic shrink-wrap, PPE, and floor debris submerged in water to (2) 15-gallon metal drums and (1) 5-gallon metal drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.
